meanings.definition: To flow or fall in drops or in a thin stream.
meanings.sent1: The water will trickle down the rocks slowly.
meanings.sent2: I watched the rain trickle down the window pane.
meanings.sent3: The leaky faucet decided to trickle at the most inconvenient time.
meanings.sent4: Her tears began to trickle down her cheeks as she listened to the sad story.
meanings.sent5: The sand trickled through the hourglass, marking the passage of time.

meanings.sent1: The trickle of water from the faucet was barely enough to fill a cup.
meanings.sent2: I heard a gentle trickle of water coming from the stream nearby.
meanings.sent3: The trickle of juice from the bottle made a sticky mess on the table.
meanings.sent4: The trickle of sweat down his forehead showed how hard he had been working.
meanings.sent5: The trickle of oil from the engine indicated a problem that needed fixing.
